source_sentence: 佛說分別緣生經
translation: Foshuo fenbie jing zhengsheng jing

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試鴻臚卿
translation: Xitian's Translation of the Sutra of the Tripiṭaka, Samzang朝奉大夫試鴻卿

source_sentence: 傳教大師臣法天奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial edict by Dharmadeva, the great minister of the transmission of the teachings

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在烏盧尾螺池邊，泥連河側菩提樹下，成佛未久，獨止其中，
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, when the Buddha was staying at the lakeside of Uruvilvā-laṅkāśa, under the tree of enlightenment on the bank of the Nairañjāna river, not long after he had attained buddhahood, he remained alone in that lake.

source_sentence: 心生思念：「世間苦法，無能免者，無能怖者，決定實有，如是觀察，
translation: The thought arose in my mind, “There is no way to escape the suffering of worldly dharmas. There is nothing that can be avoided and nothing that can be feared.

source_sentence: 是大義利；
translation: This is great benefit.

source_sentence: 世間樂法，亦復如是，無能免者，無能厭者，決定實有，如是觀察，是大義利。」
translation: So it is with worldly pleasures that there's no one who can avoid them, no one who can tire of them, and they definitely really exist; thus observing them like this is great benefit.

source_sentence: 又復思惟：「所有世間，天人魔梵、沙門婆羅門等界中，而於此法不能了知。
translation: Again, he thought, All the gods, humans, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, priests, and other worldly beings in all the worlds don't know this teaching.

source_sentence: 若復有人，善能思惟，警覺苦樂，如是了達非究竟法，常所思念，依法修行，
translation: “Furthermore, if there are people who can well contemplate and awaken to pain and pleasure, they will thus understand that it is not the ultimate truth. They will always think of it and practice according to its principles.

source_sentence: 是人當得具足戒、定、慧、解脫、解脫知見等法。
translation: That person will attain the knowledge and vision of perfect morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and liberation.

source_sentence: 所有過去未來諸佛，皆悉覺知世間苦樂，一一了知，如法修行，以自行力而成正覺。
translation: All the buddhas of all past and future buddhas completely perceive worldly sufferings and pleasures, know each one, cultivate practice according to the teaching, and attain right awakening by the power of self-reliance.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此法未曾有，無能了知者，所有過去如來、應供、正等正覺，皆於此法一一了知，
translation: This teaching has never before existed, and no one can know it. All the past buddhas, enlightening beings, saints, and perfectly enlightened ones all know this teaching one by one.

source_sentence: 如法修行，乃成正覺。
translation: Only when they cultivate practice in accordance with the Dharma will they become perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 未來世中，如來、應供、正等正覺，如是世間苦樂等法，一一了知，如法修行，
translation: “Furthermore, in the future buddhas and enlightening beings will know each of these worldly phenomena of suffering and pleasure one by one, and practice them according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 乃圓道果。」
translation: It's the fruit of the perfect path.

source_sentence: 爾時娑婆界主大梵天王，以佛威力故，知佛所念，譬如力士屈伸臂頃，
translation: At that time the lord of the sahā world, the great brahma celestial king, knew what the Buddha was thinking because of his supernatural power. Just as a strong man bends and extends his arm for an instant,

source_sentence: 離梵天界，來詣佛所，修敬畢已，住立佛前，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: They left the Brahma heaven realm and came to the Buddha. Having paid their respects, they stood before the Buddha and said:

source_sentence: 佛所思念，如是如是，世間苦樂，無能免者，是大義利，過去未來，亦復如是。
translation: The Buddha thinks, “Thus and thus, there is no one who can escape the suffering and happiness of the world. This is great benefit. So it will be in the same way in the past and future.

source_sentence: 於天人魔梵界中，唯佛世尊一一了知，若增若減、若善若惡，悉能分別，
translation: In the realm of gods, humans, Māras, and Brahmās, only the Blessed One knows each one. He can distinguish what is good and what is bad, whether it increases or decreases:

source_sentence: 緣生之法，以佛智力，如實了知。」
translation: The Dharma that arises from conditions is truly known by the Buddha's power of wisdom.

source_sentence: 佛言：「梵王！
translation: The Buddha said, Brahmā king!

source_sentence: 如是如是。
translation: So it is, so it is.

source_sentence: 世間眾生，於一切法，無智無識，不能了知，無明癡暗之所覆閉，是為無明。
translation: All sentient beings in the world lack knowledge and consciousness about all things, can't understand them, and are shrouded by ignorance, delusion, and darkness, which is ignorance.

source_sentence: 從無明緣而生於行，行有三種，謂身、口、意。
translation: Conditioned forces arise from the conditions of nescience. Conditioned forces are of three kinds: bodily, verbal and mental.

source_sentence: 復從行緣而生於識，識有六種，謂眼識、耳識、鼻識、舌識、身識、意識。
translation: Consciousness also arises from the conditioned forces of volition. Consciousness is sixfold:

source_sentence: 從於識緣而生名色，名者除色，名有四種，謂受、想、行、識；
translation: Names and forms arise from the supporting conditions of consciousness. Names are with the exception of form. There are four kinds of names:

source_sentence: 色者所謂四大，一切色法，由四大生。
translation: Form refers to the so-called four elements. All material factors arise from the four elements.

source_sentence: 如是色蘊、名蘊二種，是為名色。
translation: Thus, these two kinds of form aggregate and name aggregate are called name-and-form.

source_sentence: 從名色緣生於六處，內六處者，有其六種，謂眼處、耳處、鼻處、舌處、身處、意處。
translation: “Six sense-fields arise from name and form as supporting object”: The six internal sense-fields are sixfold: the sense-field of the eye, the sense-field of the ear, the sense-field of the nose, the sense-field of the tongue, the sense-field of the body and the one of the mind.

source_sentence: 從六處緣，復生於觸，觸有六種，謂眼觸、耳觸、鼻觸、舌觸、身觸、意觸。
translation: contact is sixfold: eye contact, ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact and mind contact.

source_sentence: 復從觸緣而生於受，受有三種，謂樂受、苦受、不苦不樂受。
translation: Feeling arises again from the conditions of contact. There are three kinds of feeling: pleasant feeling, unpleasant feeling and neither-unpleasant-nor-unpleasant feeling.

source_sentence: 復從受緣而生於愛，愛有三種，謂欲愛、色愛、無色愛。
translation: Also, craving arises from the conditions of feeling. There are three kinds of craving: craving for sensual pleasure, craving for material form, and craving for formlessness.

source_sentence: 復從愛緣而生於取，取有四種，所謂欲取、見取、戒禁取、我語取。
translation: Also, grasping arises from the conditions of craving and there are four kinds of grasping: grasping desire, grasping views, grasping precepts, and grasping self and speech.

source_sentence: 復從取緣而生於有，有者三種，謂欲有、色有、無色有。
translation: Also, existence arises from the supporting object of grasping. “Existence” is threefold:

source_sentence: 從有為緣即有生法，其生法者，謂眾生界，隨蘊生起，處處差別，生異滅法，
translation: The arising dharma refers to the dharmas that arise and perish by reason of conditioned factors, namely living beings.

source_sentence: 常所遷易。
translation: It's always subject to change.

source_sentence: 從生為本，有蘊、有界、有處，乃至命根等法，是名為生。
translation: From birth as the root, there are aggregates, realms, and places, up to the vital faculty and so forth, which are called birth.

source_sentence: 從生為緣而有老死，老者所謂心識昏昧，髮白面皺，氣力劣弱，呻吟喘息，
translation: The so-called old age is when the mind and consciousness are dull, white and wrinkled, weak and feeble, moaning and panting.

source_sentence: 身體羸劣，乃至諸根而悉衰朽，是名為老。
translation: Their bodies are weak, and even their faculties all decline, which is called old age.

source_sentence: 死復何相？
translation: What are the characteristics of death?

source_sentence: 死者謂諸眾生界趣差別，悉歸無常，壽限終盡，捨於暖觸，命根滅已，
translation: Death means that all sentient beings have different realms of rebirth and destinies. They all return to impermanence. When their life span ends, they abandon warmth and the vital principle ceases.

source_sentence: 諸蘊亦捨，四大離散，是名為死。
translation: The aggregates are also abandoned, and the four elements are dispersed, which is called death.

source_sentence: 如前所說，老與死法，是為二種。
translation: As has been said previously: old age and the dharma of death are twofold.

source_sentence: 「如是所說，即名分別緣生之法。
translation: What's explained like this is called the method of discriminating conditioned arising.

source_sentence: 若諸眾生，能了知者，是人當得具足五分法身。」
translation: If sentient beings can understand it, they'll attain the full five-part Dharma body.

source_sentence: 爾時梵王，聞佛所說緣生法已，禮佛而退，還梵天界。
translation: After hearing the Buddha's teaching on the principle of conditioned arising, the Brahma king bowed to the Buddha and withdrew back to the Brahma heaven realm.

source_sentence: 佛說分別緣生經
translation: Foshuo fenbie jing zhengsheng jing
